sen.e: Kintsumu OGIMACHISANJO (October 23, 1721 - July 6, 1777) was a kugyo (court noble) during the middle Edo period.

sen.j: 主に中御門天皇（114代）・桜町天皇（115代）・桃園天皇（116代）の三帝にわたり仕えた廷臣。
sen.e: He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who mainly served three emperors: Emperor Nakamikado (114th), Emperor Sakuramachi (115th), and Emperor Momozono (116th).

sen.j: 最終官位は従二位大権納言（薨去後従一位追贈）。
sen.e: The last official rank he received was Junii Dainagon (chief councillor of state in the Junior Second Rank); the court rank he was conferred post-humously after his death was Juichii (Junior First Rank).

sen.j: 以降累進して、侍従・左近衛少将・春宮権亮・左近衛中将をへて、寛保3年（1743年）に参議となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: After that, he was gradually promoted from the member of Palace staff to Konoefu, Togubo (Crown Prince's Quarters), Konoefu and became Sangi (councillor) in 1743, which raised his position to kugyo status.

sen.e: After this incident, even Emperor Momozono, who highly valued him as a close adviser, had to resign his governmental post due to the pressure from the bakufu.
